Class condition_variable_any

boost::sync::condition_variable_any — The condition variable class.

Synopsis

// In header: <boost/sync/condition_variables/condition_variable_any.hpp>


class condition_variable_any {
public:
  // construct/copy/destruct
  condition_variable_any();
  condition_variable_any(condition_variable_any const &) = delete;
  condition_variable_any & operator=(condition_variable_any const &) = delete;
  ~condition_variable_any();

  // public member functions
  void notify_one();
  void notify_all();
  template<typename Lock> void wait(Lock &);
  template<typename Lock, typename Predicate> void wait(Lock &, Predicate);
  template<typename Lock, typename Time> bool timed_wait(Lock &, Time const &);
  template<typename Lock, typename Time, typename Predicate> 
    bool timed_wait(Lock &, Time const &, Predicate);
  template<typename Lock, typename Duration> 
    cv_status wait_for(Lock &, Duration const &);
  template<typename Lock, typename Duration, typename Predicate> 
    bool wait_for(Lock &, Duration const &, Predicate);
  template<typename Lock, typename TimePoint> 
    cv_status wait_until(Lock &, TimePoint const &);
  template<typename Lock, typename TimePoint, typename Predicate> 
    bool wait_until(Lock &, TimePoint const &, Predicate);
};

Description

condition_variable_any public construct/copy/destruct

  1. condition_variable_any();
    Default constructor.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to create the primitive (e.g. due to insufficient resources). 

  2. condition_variable_any(condition_variable_any const &) = delete;
  3. condition_variable_any & operator=(condition_variable_any const &) = delete;
  4. ~condition_variable_any();
    Destructor.

    Destroys the condition variable.

    Requires:

    There are no threads blocked on the object.

condition_variable_any public member functions

  1. void notify_one();
    Wakes up one thread blocked on the object. 
  2. void notify_all();
    Wakes up all threads blocked on the object. 
  3. template<typename Lock> void wait(Lock & lock);
    Blocks the current thread on the object.

    Atomically unlocks the lock and blocks on the object. When unblocked, it locks the lock and returns. The function can unblock upon another thread calling notify_one(), notify_all() or spuriously.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The lock is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    		 
  4. template<typename Lock, typename Predicate> 
  void wait(Lock & lock, Predicate pred);
    Blocks the current thread on the object until the predicate is satisfied.

    Works equivalent to:

    while (!pred()) wait(lock);

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The mutex is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    pred

    Condition predicate.

    		 
  5. template<typename Lock, typename Time> 
  bool timed_wait(Lock & lock, Time const & timeout);
    Blocks the current thread on the object until the timeout expires.

    Atomically unlocks the lock and blocks on the object. When unblocked, it locks the lock and returns. The function can unblock after the specified timeout expires, upon another thread calling notify_one(), notify_all() or spuriously, whichever happens first. The timeout can be specified as an absolute time point or duration.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The lock is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    timeout

    Relative or absolute timeout. If timeout is relative, the time is measured according to the system clock.

    Returns:

    true if the function returned before the timeout expired, otherwise false.

    		 
  6. template<typename Lock, typename Time, typename Predicate> 
  bool timed_wait(Lock & lock, Time const & timeout, Predicate pred);
    Blocks the current thread on the object until the predicate is satisfied or the timeout expires.

    If the timeout is an absolute time point, works equivalent to:

    while (!pred()) if (!timed_wait(lock, timeout)) return pred();

    otherwise works as if equivalent to:

    auto abs_timeout = chrono::system_clock::now() + timeout; while (!pred()) if (!timed_wait(lock, abs_timeout)) return pred();

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The lock is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    pred

    Condition predicate.

    timeout

    Relative or absolute timeout. If timeout is relative, the time is measured according to the system clock. 

  7. template<typename Lock, typename Duration> 
  cv_status wait_for(Lock & lock, Duration const & rel_timeout);
    Blocks the current thread on the object until the timeout expires.

    Atomically unlocks the lock and blocks on the object. When unblocked, it locks the lock and returns. The function can unblock after the specified timeout expires, upon another thread calling notify_one(), notify_all() or spuriously, whichever happens first. The timeout must be specified as a time duration.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The lock is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    Returns:

    cv_status::no_timeout if the function returned before the timeout expired, otherwise cv_status::timeout.

    		 
  8. template<typename Lock, typename Duration, typename Predicate> 
  bool wait_for(Lock & lock, Duration const & rel_timeout, Predicate pred);
    Blocks the current thread on the object until the timeout expires.

    Works equivalent to:

    return wait_until(lock, chrono::system_clock::now() + rel_timeout, pred);

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The lock is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    pred

    Condition predicate.

    		 
  9. template<typename Lock, typename TimePoint> 
  cv_status wait_until(Lock & lock, TimePoint const & abs_timeout);
    Blocks the current thread on the object until the timeout expires.

    Atomically unlocks the lock and blocks on the object. When unblocked, it locks the lock and returns. The function can unblock after the specified timeout expires, upon another thread calling notify_one(), notify_all() or spuriously, whichever happens first. The timeout must be specified as an absolute time point.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The lock is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    Returns:

    cv_status::no_timeout if the function returned before the timeout expired, otherwise cv_status::timeout.

    		 
  10. template<typename Lock, typename TimePoint, typename Predicate> 
  bool wait_until(Lock & lock, TimePoint const & abs_timeout, Predicate pred);
    Blocks the current thread on the object until the timeout expires.

    Works equivalent to:

    while (!pred()) if (wait_until(lock, timeout) == cv_status::timeout) return pred();

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. The lock is left in the locked state in case of exception.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    lock

    Lock object. Must be a model of BasicLockable.

    pred

    Condition predicate.
